item.title: How To Watch the 2025 NWSL Championship: Washington Spirit vs. Gotham FC
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The 2025 NWSL Playoffs are here, and the latest media deal has spread the games across various broadcasters. Here's our expert guide on how to watch every match on TV.

The post How To Watch the 2025 NWSL Championship: Washington Spirit vs. Gotham FC appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The 2025 NWSL Playoffs are championship-bound after an intense semifinal round. Last weekend was packed with drama, as the Washington Spirit punched their ticket to the final by taking out the Portland Thorns in a 2–0 battle. But the real story is Gotham FC, who continued their unbelievable run by stunning the Orlando Pride (and breaking my heart) in the dying minutes of Sunday’s clash.

Now, the Spirit will face Gotham for the title on Saturday, November 22, at 8:00 p.m. ET. As a fan, this is the one you can’t miss. To help you get ready, I’ve got the full broadcast details and my expert tips on the best way to watch below.

Jump to:

  • NWSL Playoffs TV schedule
  • Best NWSL Playoffs TV plans
  • Watch the NWSL Playoffs for free

Upgrade your TV plan for the NWSL Playoffs!

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s best TV and internet providers.

What channels show the NWSL Playoffs?

You’ll need access to at least three different channels and platforms to watch the complete 2025 NWSL Playoffs.

  • ABC (2 quarterfinals, 1 semifinal)
  • Amazon Prime Video (1 quarterfinal)
  • CBS (1 quarterfinal, 1 semifinal, and the NWSL Championship)

Pro tip: Games airing on ABC will stream simultaneously on ESPN+ via the new ESPN Select/Unlimited platform. Meanwhile, all games airing on CBS will stream live on Paramount+ Premium.

2025 NWSL Playoffs TV schedule

This year’s NWSL playoff format is all about high-stakes drama. We’ve got the top eight teams in a single-elimination tournament, and my favorite part of this setup? The top-seeded teams don’t get a bye, meaning every club enters the must-win chaos from the start.

Check out the full 2025 NWSL playoff schedule below to find all game times and channel listings.

Game Date Time (ET) Channels
Quarterfinals
(5) Seattle Reign at (4) Orlando Pride Friday, Nov. 7 8:00 p.m. Amazon Prime Video
(7) Racing Louisville at (2) Washington Spirit Saturday, Nov. 8 Noon CBS, Paramount+
(8) Gotham FC at (1) Kansas City Current Sunday, Nov. 9 12:30 p.m. ABC, ESPN+
(6) San Diego Wave at (3) Portland Thorns Sunday, Nov. 9 3:00 p.m. ABC, ESPN+
Semifinals
(3) Portland Thorns at (2) Washington Spirit Saturday, Nov. 15 Noon CBS, Paramount+
(8) Gotham FC at (4) Orlando Pride Sunday, Nov. 16 3:00 p.m. ABC, ESPN+
NWSL Championship
(8) Gotham FC vs. (2) Washington Spirit Saturday, Nov. 22 8:00 p.m. CBS, Paramount+

Data effective as of post date.

Best TV plans for watching the NWSL Playoffs

If you’ve been watching the NWSL all season, you likely already have access to every playoff channel. But if you’re just joining in, you’ll need a clear viewing strategy. That’s because no single TV service includes ABC, CBS, and Amazon Prime Video.

The most straightforward way to watch every playoff game is to build your own “à la carte” streaming bundle. You’ll need three separate subscriptions: Prime Video (for the Prime-exclusive quarterfinal), a Paramount+ Premium plan (for all the CBS games), and an ESPN Select subscription (which gets you the ESPN+ simulcasts of the ABC games). This entire setup will cost you around $35 a month, and you can cancel everything right after the championship.

There’s also one other, even cheaper way to watch most of the games. Since the ABC and CBS matches are on broadcast TV, a digital antenna can get you six of the seven playoff games for free. I cover that viewing method in more detail in the Watch for Free section below.

Which TV providers carry the NWSL Playoffs?

For those who prefer the traditional cable or satellite route, you’re still in good shape. You’ll need a separate subscription for the Prime Video match, but most major TV providers (like DIRECTV, Spectrum, and Xfinity) carry both ABC and CBS.

To simplify things, I’ve broken down the channel availability for 13 popular services in the table below.

Read Cox review

Score the best TV service in your area

Not every TV provider is available nationwide. Enter your zip code below to find the best NWSL viewing options for your home turf.

How to watch the NWSL Playoffs for free

You have two fantastic strategies for watching the NWSL Playoffs for free: using a digital antenna and taking advantage of free trials.

I prefer using an antenna because I live within range of my local ABC and CBS affiliates, which will show six of the seven playoff games. An antenna is a simple, one-time purchase that gets you the vast majority of the tournament for free. You just need to live within a 70-mile radius of an affiliate and have no major physical obstructions near your home.

Heads up: Before you buy an antenna, I recommend using the FCC’s Reception Map Tool or Antennas Direct’s TV Transmitter Locator to see which channels are available near you.

For the one quarterfinal that streams exclusively on Prime Video, your best bet is to sign up for the service’s 30-day free trial. Live TV streaming services like DIRECTV and Fubo also offer free trials to pick up ABC and CBS if the antenna method doesn’t work for you.

How to watch the NWSL Playoffs FAQ

How many teams go to the NWSL Playoffs?

The top eight NWSL teams, based on the final regular-season standings, qualify for the playoffs. The league expanded its postseason format in 2024 to coincide with the introduction of expansion teams Bay FC and the Utah Royals.

What channel is the NWSL Championship Game on?

The 2025 NWSL Championship will air on CBS on Saturday, November 22, at 8:00 p.m. ET. You can also stream the game live on Paramount+ Premium.

How can I watch the NWSL Playoffs internationally?

Internationally, NWSL playoff matches will mainly stream for free on NWSL+. But the league has global media partnerships in certain countries and territories that may impact NWSL+ access. For example, TNT Sports will air all playoff games in the U.K.

Can I watch the NWSL Playoffs on Paramount+?

Yes, you can watch three NWSL playoff games on Paramount+. The service's higher-tier Premium plan will stream every playoff match that airs on CBS, which includes one quarterfinal, one semifinal, and the NWSL Championship.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, has been an avid follower of the NWSL since 2016 and has been covering the league professionally since 2019. For this guide, he combined that deep fan perspective with hours of expert research, cross-referencing the official 2025 playoff bracket with the channel lineups of every major TV provider. Taylor based his recommendations on finding the most cost-effective and convenient ways for you to watch every single match.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

  • Best Streaming Services for Sports

item.title: NBA Schedule This Week: Your Guide to the Best Week 5 Games on TV
item.dc:creator: Alex Vejar
item.description:
CableTV.com’s NBA expert maps out the weekly TV schedule and breaks down the top games, key player matchups, and storylines so you know exactly what to watch.

The post NBA Schedule This Week: Your Guide to the Best Week 5 Games on TV appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Two overtime games. Three incredible tying or game-winning buckets. And that was just last Monday!

The fourth week of the NBA season had some true nail-biters, some absolute clunkers (I’m looking at you, Lakers), and some interesting off-court moments as well. Will Week 5 be that compelling to watch and follow? Boy, I hope so.

If you’re an NBA devotee, here’s what you should be checking out during the fifth week of the 2025–2026 NBA season, and what I thought of some of last week’s action.

Jump to:

  • National NBA game of the week
  • NBA League Pass game of the week
  • NBA schedule this week
  • League news and analysis

National NBA game of the week

Detroit Pistons at Milwaukee Bucks | NBA TV

I wrote last week that I was still undecided about the Pistons and needed to see them beat better teams. Here’s a chance for that.

Detroit basketball has been thriving in 2025–2026 so far. The team lives in the paint and plays very, very good defense. Their rise has been a surprise to basically anyone who follows the NBA.

The Bucks need this game, too. They’re in the morass of Eastern Conference teams logjammed in the standings, and have very few signature wins thus far. Giannis Antetokounmpo is playing at an MVP-level, though, and it will be interesting to see how Detroit defends him.

How to watch Detroit Pistons at Milwaukee Bucks
Date:
Saturday, Nov. 22
Time: 8:00 p.m. ET
National channel: NBA TV
Location: Fiserv Forum, Milwaukee, WI

Stream with DIRECTV

Honorable mention: 

  • Denver Nuggets and Houston Rockets | NBA Cup (Friday, Nov. 21, 9:30 p.m. ET, Amazon Prime Video).

NBA League Pass game of the week

New York Knicks at Miami Heat | NBA League Pass

I’ve been hearing a lot about this newfangled offense the Heat run, so it’s about time I mention them in this space. They’ve been a solid team all season, beating the Knicks and Cavs already. And the fact that they don’t really run pick-and-rolls is interesting as hell and worth watching, particularly in a league largely defined by that action.

The Knicks are the Knicks. They’re really good. Jalen Brunson and Karl-Anthony Towns are fun to watch and will be all season, barring injury, of course.

This game is gonna be fun. I can’t wait.

How to watch New York Knicks at Miami Heat
Date:
Monday, Nov. 17
Time: 7:30 p.m. ET
Local channels: MSG, FDSSUN
Out-of-market: NBA League Pass
Location: Kaseya Center, Miami, FL

Try League Pass

Honorable mention: 

  • Toronto Raptors at Philadelphia 76ers (Wednesday, Nov. 19, 7:00 p.m. ET).

San Antonio Spurs at Phoenix Suns Sunday, Nov. 23 8:00 p.m. Arizona's Family 3TV, Suns Live, FDSSW, NBA League Pass
Los Angeles Lakers at Utah Jazz Sunday, Nov. 23 8:00 p.m. KJZZ-TV, Jazz+, Spectrum SportsNet, Spectrum SportsNet+, NBA League Pass

Data effective as of post date.

Swishes and airballs: My hot takes from NBA Week 4

The fourth week of the 2025–2026 NBA season was truly fascinating. Here’s what stood out to me.

Swish: Nico Harrison got fired. The Dallas Mavericks general manager who traded away a generational player in Luka Doncic to the Los Angeles Lakers for Anthony Davis—who has barely played since—is gone. It’s about time.

There were “Fire Nico” chants raining down during home games. The team sucks. Doncic is the leading MVP candidate. There’s just no way Harrison was gonna last.

Airball: Yet another new NBA All-Star Game format. The league is finally doing a U.S. vs. World game, but putting it in the strange round-robin tournament style of last year. Yay to positionless voting, boo to Commissioner Adam Silver possibly needing to make the teams uneven if the voting doesn’t garner 16 U.S. players and eight international players.

Overall, though, I’ve come to the conclusion that the All-Star Game doesn’t matter, and we don’t need to spend this much time and energy trying to fix it. The real fix-it energy should be paid to the dunk contest.

Swish: Jalen Williams’s comedy. After the Oklahoma City Thunder put a beatdown on the Lakers, ESPN’s Malika Andrews was conducting the postgame interview with Shai Gilgeous-Alexander. But in the background, the injured Jalen Williams was making faces at the camera. It was delightful.

But what really made my night even after my favorite team lost so badly was what Williams said just before the camera cut away.

“I’m still on the team,” he said before getting closer to the microphone. “ESPN, I still play basketball, I swear.”

The video of his actual quote is hilarious. You should take a minute to watch.

"ESPN, I still play basketball, I swear." 😂

JDub after OKC's huge back-to-back wins over the Warriors and Lakers ⚡ pic.twitter.com/4Z7isSSKiO

— ESPN (@espn) November 13, 2025

NBA schedule this week FAQ

When does the NBA season end?

The 2025–2026 NBA season ends Sunday, April 12, 2026.

How many games are in an NBA season?

The NBA season officially has 82 games. But since the addition of the NBA Cup, that number is technically 83 for the two teams that advance to the championship game of that tournament. The championship game doesn’t count as a regular-season game.

When is the NBA trade deadline?

The NBA trade deadline for the 2025–2026 season is February 6, 2026, at 3:00 p.m. ET.

Where can I watch Inside the NBA?

Inside the NBA will air on ABC and ESPN throughout the season. It will also include the show’s signature pregame and halftime shows.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports writer, Alex Vejar, is a passionate NBA fan who follows the league by watching multiple games per week. He analyzed the NBA schedule and made his viewing recommendations based on matchups, star power, style of play, and unique or interesting viewing experiences.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods for reviewing TV services.

item.dc:creator: Eric Chiu
item.description:
Don’t miss a snap! Find the full Week 13 schedule for watching college football today on TV. We cover channel lineups and which games are must-watch matchups.

The post Best College Football Games Today on TV | Week 13 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Expectations can be a lot, sometimes. Especially around this time of year, everyone’s rushing to hit their goals before the season wraps up. If you ask this watch guide, we think attitude and approach count for a lot when it comes to achieving your end-of-year goals.

On one end, Pitt demonstrated the power of managing expectations after losing by 15 points instead of 100, and Texas affirmatively pivoted its postseason goals to “Cheez-It Bowl, I guess?” after its loss to Georgia. But if last weekend taught us anything? Like with Texas A&M’s comeback win, it’s not about how you start the year! It’s how you finish it. (Also, Kirby Smart absolutely thinks Steve Sarkisian’s a fancy city boy.)

For the Week 13 edition of the CableTV.com College Football What to Watch Guide, we’ll claw across the finish line, investigate the paranormal, and take it to the limit.

Jump to:

  • CableTV.com’s Game of the Week
  • Week 13’s best college football games
  • College football TV schedule: Week 13

Interested in college football games today?

Subscribe to our email newsletter for the latest football takes, TV subscription deals, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

CableTV.com’s college football Game of the Week

Watch USC vs. Oregon | CBS

Why you should watch: It’s been a while since we’ve seen the Trojans and Ducks match up on the field, but in (somehow) their first game as Big Ten opponents, the stakes are appropriately high.

With identical 6–1 records in conference play, USC and Oregon are in pole position for the Big Ten’s potential third playoff bid. The Trojans are riding a solid three-game win streak after surviving defense slogs against Nebraska and Iowa, while the Ducks returned to form with a 42–13 win against Minnesota last week.

Net adj. EPA/Play through Week 12, P4

Top 5 (note: Toledo is 5th nationally)
Ohio State: +0.37
Oregon: +0.28
USC: +0.26
Texas A&M: +0.25
Indiana: +0.22 pic.twitter.com/cvdCAbHP2y

— Game on Paper (@gameonpaper) November 17, 2025

Oddsmakers and analysts generally favor the Ducks over USC, but the Trojans could pull the upset with a strong game from running back King Miller. Oregon’s rush defense has its gaps, as it ranks 74th in rushing defensive success rate. (But considering USC’s ground defense is even more porous, they’ll need a Herculean effort to steal a win here.)

How to watch #16 USC at #6 Oregon

vs.

Date: Saturday, Nov. 22
Time: 3:30 p.m. ET
Channel: CBS
Location: Autzen Stadium in Eugene, OR
Point spread: Oregon by 9.5

Stream on DIRECTV

CableTV.com’s Homefield Apparel of the Week

Based in Indianapolis, Homefield offers officially licensed college apparel with exclusive vintage designs that draw from the history of more than 150 colleges. This week’s Homefield picks highlight vault pulls, bomber jackets, and more from Homefield’s USC and Oregon collections.

Want to upgrade your gameday fit? Click the link below to check out Homefield’s collections, and use promo code CABLETV to save 15% off your first order.

Buy Homefield College Football Shirts

CableTV.com’s top college football games for Week 13

Watch Florida State vs. NC State | ESPN
Watch Hawaii vs. UNLV | FS1

Why you should watch: This week’s weekday slate is headlined by a rare Friday night appearance from Hawaii, as the Rainbow Warriors head to Vegas to play UNLV. Hawaii’s 32-point whomping of San Diego State remains one of the Mountain West’s biggest upsets this season, while the Rebels needed double overtime to get past Utah State last weekend.

Over in the ACC, we’ve got a classic EligiBowl matchup between 5–5 Florida State and NC State. Both squads have rebounded from the dregs of the conference standings and could use a win to improve the vibes (and avoid paying a huge buyout).

How to watch Florida State at NC State

 vs.  

Date: Friday, Nov. 21
Time: 8:00 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN
Location: Carter-Finley Stadium in Raleigh, NC
Point spread: Florida State by 4.5

How to watch Hawaii at UNLV

 vs. 

Date: Friday, Nov. 21
Time: 10:00 p.m. ET
Channel: FS1
Location: Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas, NV
Point spread: UNLV by 2.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch Washington State vs. James Madison | ESPN+
Watch Tulane vs. Temple | ESPNU

Why you should watch: The Group of 5 playoff race has been a mess all season, but with South Florida falling out of contention last weekend, we’re finally getting some clarity about the likely frontrunners.

James Madison’s rumored GameDay spot might’ve been debunked, but by ESPN’s FPI, the 9–1 Dukes have a 54% chance of landing a playoff bid. The 5–5 Cougars are moderate underdogs, but they’re plucky enough to keep things interesting. (Most disappointingly, we missed the chance to showcase the Cougar Marching Band’s excellent taste in 2000s Internet on national TV. Fhqwhgads!)

The Washington State University Cougar Marching Band played Trogdor at halftime this weekend! And made ME! My husky head finally gets the spectacle it desoives! pic.twitter.com/ZjJAjrpRGz

— Strong Bad (@StrongBadActual) November 17, 2025

Back in the American, Tulane and North Texas are in a two-team race for second place in the conference standings and a potential playoff bid. Tulane should handle its business against 5–5 Temple, but quarterback Evan Simon is a sneakily decent triggerman for the Owls—he ranks 32nd nationally in quarterback rating and has thrown 22 touchdowns against one pick this year.

How to watch Washington State at #21 James Madison

vs.

Date: Saturday, Nov. 22
Time: 1:00 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN+
Location: Bridgeforth Stadium in Harrisonburg, VA
Point spread: James Madison by 13.5

How to watch #24 Tulane at Temple

vs.  

Date: Saturday, Nov. 22
Time: 3:45 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPNU
Location: Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia, PA
Point spread: Tulane by 8.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch UConn vs. Florida Atlantic | ESPN+

Why you should watch: “NIL changed everything” is well-trod territory, but its effects on this year’s coaching carousel remain legitimately nifty.

On one hand, the number of schools and candidates who’ve taken themselves off the board in a market with Penn State, LSU, and Florida openings shows how well college football accidentally created parity for itself, somehow? On the other hand, this absolutely means one school is hurtling towards The Stupid Zone for a Plan D backup hire. (Auburn coach Jon Gruden exists in a pocket dimension, folks.)

Skyler Bell is legit. He flashed back in his time at Wisconsin, but he’s morphed into a true three-level threat at UConn.

Solid lean mass and brisk open-field acceleration, and when you dive deeper, he incorporates the little details well, too.

pic.twitter.com/fMZRwMc6rQ

— Ian Cummings (@IC_Draft) October 25, 2025

8–3 UConn remains one of the season’s best surprises, as the Jim Mora Jr.-led Huskies racked up solid wins against higher-tier competition like Duke, and have one of the nation’s best receivers in Skyler Bell. If you’re feeling especially spicy, UConn is 13 points and three last-second losses away from being 11–0, and an even likelier 12–0 ahead of this week’s matchup with FAU. With his track record in Storrs, teams are likely kicking the tires on Mora’s willingness to jump back up the job ladder.

While we wouldn’t begrudge it as impartial observers, we’d also point out the value of being somewhere you’re appreciated. Eight to ten-win seasons where everyone’s having a good time is nothing to sneeze at! Some dads pick up woodworking as a retirement project, and there’s nothing wrong with Jim Mora Jr.’s project being “UConn football head coach.” (Another project: figuring out whether the ghosts in his haunted house are Ghosts friendly or Haunting of Hill House spooky.)

How to watch UConn at Florida Atlantic

 vs.  

Date: Saturday, Nov. 22
Time: 3:00 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN+
Location: Flagler Credit Union Stadium in Boca Raton, FL
Point spread: UConn by 7.5

Stream on DIRECTV

item.title: What To Watch This Week: Stream Our Top 7 TV and Movie Picks (Nov. 17–23)
item.dc:creator: Randy Harward
item.description:
Check out our What to Watch This Week column for Nov. 17–23, where we recommend the best shows, movies, and more on TV this week. Our recommendations include Thoughts and Prayers (HBO and HBO Max), Train Dreams (Netflix), A Man on the Inside (Netflix), and The Assassin (AMC+). Let’s hit the couch!

The post What To Watch This Week: Stream Our Top 7 TV and Movie Picks (Nov. 17–23) appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
CableTV.com’s fall TV preview guide is here!

Embrace cozy season with the best fall TV! The TV experts at CableTV.com have curated a list of top fall TV shows to help you find something to binge-watch while the leaves drop.

New on TV this week

This week’s “What To Watch” picks include the school shooting documentary Thoughts and Prayers (HBO and HBO Max), the drama Train Dreams (Netflix), the return of A Man on the Inside (Netflix), and the AMC+ thriller The Assassin.

We also recommend a couple of comedy specials from Gerry Dee and Kathleen Madigan, plus Tallywacker on video-on-demand (VOD). Let’s hit the couch!

Night owl? Peep what’s on late-night TV this week.

New on Netflix this week

Gerry Dee: Funny You Should Say That | Netflix | Stand-up comedy

Special, Tuesday, Nov. 18: If you haven’t seen the Canadian sitcom Mr. D, where Canadian teacher-turned-comedian Gerry Dee plays a (wait for it) underqualified high school teacher, you really oughta check it out. Not necessarily before you see Dee’s stand-up act, though. On his show or behind the mic, the affable, authentic Dee mines his life for his goofy-but-sage humor. Fittingly, this special is based on Dee’s book of the same name, which collects various autobiographical essays.

If you wanna see Mr. D, The Roku Channel has all eight seasons for free. Prime Video has seven of those seasons, and Tubi has the first one.

Best Movies and Shows on Netflix

Pro tip: Looking for more to watch? Check out Sophie Hastings’ article, Best True Crime Documentaries.

New on HBO and HBO Max this week

Thoughts and Prayers | HBO, HBO Max | Documentary

Movie, Tuesday, Nov. 18, 9:00 p.m. ET: The title of this documentary about school shootings has a cringey ring. Attribute that to the phrase being a ubiquitous, useless response to a grave issue. In press materials for this film by Zackary Canepari and Jessica Dimmock, HBO writes, “Equal parts absurd and unsettlingly real, the film traces the $3 billion active shooter preparedness industry and its effect on students and educators, raising important questions about the unintended consequences of these intense preparations. In the absence of meaningful prevention efforts and gun reform, how far will Americans go to prepare for active shooters?”

Best Movies and Shows on HBO Max

See what to watch this weekend on all platforms

Click on your favorite streaming service below to see new releases and classic recommendations from our TV critics.

New on Netflix this week

A Man on the Inside | Netflix | Comedy

Special, Tuesday, Nov. 18: This fantastic comedy-mystery series from Mike Schur (The Good Place, Parks and Recreation) and starring Ted Danson returns for a second season—and a new mystery. This time, accidental gumshoe Charles (Danson) is going back to college with an almost entirely new cast that includes Mary Steenburgen (Danson’s IRL wife), Mary Elizabeth Ellis (Danson’s show daughter), Stephanie Beatriz, Jason Mantzoukas, Jill Talley, Gary Cole, and more.

Best Movies and Shows on Netflix

New on AMC and AMC+ this week

The Assassin | AMC+ | Drama, thriller

Limited series premiere, Thursday, Nov. 20: The first season of this thriller series aired on Amazon Prime Video UK last summer, and it was such a hit that AMC+ picked it up as a North American exclusive—and producers are considering a second season. The show stars Keely Hawes (Scoop) as a retired assassin whose past catches up to her and her investigative journalist son (Freddie Highmore of Bates Motel and The Good Doctor). All six episodes will be available to stream today.

Read Our AMC+ Review

Want more new TV shows?

« Catch Up on the Best TV Shows of 2024
Discover the Best TV Shows of 2025 »

New on Prime Video this week

Kathleen Madigan: The Family Thread | Prime Video | Stand-up comedy

Special, Friday, Nov. 21: Comedian Kathleen Madigan’s sixth stand-up special, 2023’s Hunting Bigfoot (Prime Video), won Comedy Special of the Year from the readers of the comedy website The Interrobang. In her newly minted seventh hour-long special, Prime Video says, “Audiences can expect her signature sharp wit as she tackles gambling as math education, Midwest pioneers, her four cats, aging parents, and modern church competition, showcasing her mastery of crafting the perfect joke.”

Best Movies and Shows on Prime Video

Looking for your next binge-watch?

« Binge an Entire Show This Weekend
Start a Classic Binge-Worthy Show »

New on Netflix this week

Train Dreams | Netflix | Drama

Movie, Friday, Nov. 21: Denis Johnson’s novella of the same name is the basis for this Sundance hit by director Clint Bentley. Joel Edgerton (Golden Globe Award-winner for 2016’s Loving) portrays Robert Grainier, a rail worker in the Pacific Northwest at the turn of the 20th century. The film covers decades of Grainier’s life as he struggles with his place in the world, including commitments to his family, from which he’s frequently absent. The cast also includes Felicity Jones and William H. Macy.

Best Movies and Shows on Netflix

New movie releases available to rent/buy on VOD this week

Tallywacker (2025) | Comedy, drama

With its black-and-white imagery, punk rock soundtrack, and slacker humor, Tallywacker looks like a refugee from ‘90s independent cinema—and I’m here for it. The film follows Aleister, a disabled guitar player who lands a gig with a major artist, but it might ruin his best friendship. You can rent Tallywacker from video-on-demand (VOD) outlets like Prime Video, Google Movies & TV, and Fandango at Home (formerly VUDU) as of Tuesday, Nov. 18.

VOD releases this week

  • The Making of a Japanese (Nov. 18) Watch Trailer

  • Vindication Swim (Nov. 18) Watch Trailer

  • Before We Begin (Nov. 21) Watch Trailer

  • Krzyk: Losing Control (Nov. 21) Watch Trailer

item.title: How To Watch NBA Black Friday Games in 2025
item.dc:creator: Alex Vejar
item.description:
Save some room after Thanksgiving for some sweet and savory NBA action on Black Friday. Use our comprehensive guide to watch the NBA on Black Friday on TV.

The post How To Watch NBA Black Friday Games in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Thanksgiving is a holiday for turkey and football. But Black Friday, at least for me, is dedicated to watching exciting NBA action while kicking back with some tasty leftovers.

Luckily, there are plenty of NBA games to choose from the day after Thanksgiving. So if you’ve already done your shopping for Black Friday deals and are wondering how to get your basketball on, you’ve come to the right place.

In this guide, I’ll help you figure out what NBA games are airing on Black Friday and how to watch them.

Jump to:

  • NBA Black Friday channels
  • NBA Black Friday TV schedule
  • Best NBA Black Friday TV plans
  • Watch NBA Black Friday for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have NBA Black Friday games?

Nine of the 11 NBA games on Black Friday will air on local channels or regional sports networks. The remaining two will stream exclusively on Amazon Prime Video.

Pro tip: Out-of-market fans can access non-national NBA games with NBA League Pass.

2025 NBA Black Friday TV schedule

More than two-thirds of the NBA is playing the day after Thanksgiving. So grab some leftover turkey, make yourself a heaping sandwich, and settle in to a night full of basketball.

Check out the full NBA on Black Friday schedule below. I’ve got the Lakers-Mavericks game circled on my calendar because I expect Luka Doncic to go crazy on his former team. The game between the Nuggets and the Spurs should also be an absolute doozy.

Game Time (ET) Channels
Cleveland Cavaliers at Atlanta Hawks 7:30 p.m. FDSOH, FDSSE
Philadelphia 76ers at Brooklyn Nets 7:30 p.m. NBCSP, YES
Chicago Bulls at Charlotte Hornets 7:30 p.m. Chicago Sports Network, FDSSE
Orlando Magic at Detroit Pistons 7:30 p.m. FDSFL, FDSDET
Washington Wizards at Indiana Pacers 7:30 p.m. Monumental Sports Network, FDSIN
Milwaukee Bucks at New York Knicks 7:30 p.m. Amazon Prime Video
Phoenix Suns at Oklahoma City Thunder 9:30 p.m. 3TV/AFS, FDSOK
San Antonio Spurs at Denver Nuggets 9:30 p.m. KENS, Altidude
Sacramento Kings at Utah Jazz 9:30 p.m. NBC Sports California, KJZZ
Dallas Mavericks at Los Angeles Lakers 10:00 p.m. Amazon Prime Video
Memphis Grizzlies at Los Angeles Clippers 10:00 p.m. FDSSE, FDSSC

Data effective as of post date.

Best TV plans for watching NBA Black Friday games

Three options exist for fans who want to watch NBA games on Black Friday—the local way, the national way, and the out-of-market way. I detail which services you’ll need for each scenario below.

And remember: You can always combine these services in whichever way you want to watch as many NBA games as possible.

DIRECTV ($89.99–$169.99/mo.)

Local NBA fans will be best served by signing up for DIRECTV satellite service or Stream with DIRECTV. It comes with the largest number of regional sports networks of any TV service out there, with Fubo being a close second.

Most NBA games on Black Friday are on an RSN, and many of those are somewhere under the FanDuel Sports Network umbrella. Also, if you get the streaming version of DIRECTV, you can try it free for five days.

Amazon Prime Video ($8.99–$17.98/mo.)

Two games will stream on Amazon Prime Video on Black Friday, and they’re considered marquee matchups. So if you consider yourself a hardcore NBA fan, you’ll want to make sure you have access to the streamer.

Prime Video also features a multitude of original movies and TV shows. And for NFL fans, Thursday Night Football streams exclusively on the platform, as does the Black Friday Game. It’s a robust hub of various types of entertainment that stretches far beyond the NBA on Black Friday.

NBA League Pass ($16.99–$24.99/mo.)

For fans who live in different markets of their favorite teams, NBA League Pass is a move more clutch than Michael Jordan’s crossover that led to the game-winner against the Utah Jazz in the 1998 Finals.

Not only will you get to watch your team on Black Friday, but you can also watch replays of any other game you missed that day. League Pass is available as an add-on through Amazon Prime Video and DIRECTV.

Score the best TV plan!

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch NBA Black Friday games for free

The best way to get any of the November 28 NBA games free is by using free trials.

DIRECTV has a five-day free streaming trial for new customers, while Amazon Prime Video has a 30-day free trial. Both of those give you plenty of time to sign up, watch a lot of Black Friday basketball, and take the services for a spin before committing financially.

Prime Video also offers a seven-day free trial of NBA League Pass.

How to watch NBA Black Friday games FAQ

When is Black Friday 2025?

Black Friday in 2025 is on Friday, November 28.

How many NBA games are on Black Friday?

Black Friday will feature 11 NBA games between 7:30 p.m. and 10:00 p.m. ET.

What sports happen on Black Friday?

Amazon Prime Video will feature golf, NFL, and NBA games on Black Friday. Other leagues playing are the NHL, college football, and college basketball.

Can I stream NBA Black Friday games?

Yes, you can stream NBA games on Black Friday with a subscription to Amazon Prime Video, Stream with DIRECTV, or NBA League Pass.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports writer, Alex Vejar, reviewed this season’s Black Friday NBA schedule. He then researched traditional and streaming TV providers to assess which ones would give fans the most comprehensive access to watching those games, and made his recommendations based on that information.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

  • I Calculated the Cost of Watching the NBA on TV
  • NBA Schedule This Week
  • Best Streaming Services for Sports

item.title: How To Watch Alabama Football
item.dc:creator: Eric Chiu
item.description:
Roll Tide! Check out our college football schedule guide for the Alabama Crimson Tide.

The post How To Watch Alabama Football appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Watch Free with Fubo

Alabama fans, close out of those message boards and stop waiting for the Finebaum call-in line: CableTV.com’s here for you after a rough year.

Everyone anticipated some growing pains during Kalen DeBoer’s first season in Tuscaloosa, but missing the College Football Playoff? Dropping four games with sloppy defensive play? Losing to Vanderbilt?!

But for as rocky as things got last year, don’t throw out your jersey and flash back to the Mike Shula era just yet. This offseason, Alabama reeled in yet another top-five recruiting class and reunited with new offensive coordinator Ryan Grubb, who guided DeBoer’s 2023 Washington Huskies squad to the national championship game. (And of course, having players like receiver Ryan Williams ensures that Alabama’s floor remains safely high.)

Can Alabama bounce back after a tough year and return to the postseason? Here’s what you need to know if you want to watch Alabama football on TV this season.

Jump to:

  • Watch Alabama vs. Florida State
  • Alabama football TV schedule
  • Watch Alabama football live

How can I watch the Alabama game today?

Alabama kicks off the 2025 season against Florida State on Saturday, August 30, at 2:30 p.m. CT on ABC.

Check out our How To Watch College Football guide and college football schedule preview column to learn how to watch college football on TV today. Want to watch Alabama football on TV? Enter your zip code below to see providers in your area.

Alabama football TV schedule 2025

Alabama’s non-conference slate should give the Crimson Tide ample opportunities to work out some kinks. Despite Week 1’s disastrous loss to Florida State, the Tide should still be favored in tune-up games against Louisiana-Monroe and Wisconsin.

BYU star quarterback Jake Retzlaff was accused of sexual assault, faced a seven-game suspension from the religious school for violating its honor code, withdrew from the school, and is reportedly headed to Tulane. So what’s next for the Cougars?

Now in their second year in the American Conference, the Black Knights must battle through a tough conference schedule peppered with high-profile non-conference games. Every regular-season game serves as preparation for the season-defining matchups against their service academy rivals.

The post How To Watch Florida State Seminoles Football in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Few teams in college football have a wider range of possibilities heading into the 2025 season than the Florida State Seminoles. After a near-perfect 13–1 campaign in 2023, the program took a historic downturn, finishing last season with an abysmal 2–10 record. The dramatic swing has left fans and rivals alike wondering which version of the team will show up this fall.

The task of orchestrating a rebound falls to head coach Mike Norvell, now in his sixth year. The journey back to national relevance for Florida State University will be waged in the competitive Atlantic Coast Conference (ACC). It all begins in front of the passionate home crowd at Doak Campbell Stadium on August 30 vs. Alabama (woof, what a draw).

For the faithful who want to watch Florida State football through every high and low this year, most games will be broadcast across the ESPN family of networks. The ACC Network will be a crucial channel for any fan, with other key matchups airing on ABC and ESPN. Keep reading as I outline the complete TV schedule and cover which streaming service is ideal for watching every snap this season.
